usefulItems: bowl, ovenproof baking dish, jug, frying pan (20 cm), plate, oven grill, oven, stove top
title: Ricotta and spinach crespelle 'cake'

ingredients.content: 80 g Parmesan cheese, cut into pieces (3 cm)
5 sprigs fresh chives, cut into quarters, plus extra chopped for garnishing
4 spring onions/shallots, trimmed and cut into quarters
20 g salted butter, cut into pieces, plus extra for frying

preparations.content: Place Parmesan into mixing bowl and grate <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place chives, flour, polenta, eggs, milk, oil and 40 g of the reserved Parmesan into mixing bowl and blend <b>30 sec/speed 5<b>. Transfer into a jug and set aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Preheat oven to 220°C. Set aside a shallow ovenproof baking dish (25 cm).
Place spring onions/shallots into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add butter and spinach and sauté <b>5 min/100°C/speed 1<b>, stirring with aid of spatula, until spinach  wilts.
Add ricotta, salt and pepper and mix <b>5 sec/speed 4<b>.

Place a frying pan (20 cm) over medium-high heat and add 1 teaspoon of butter. Stir reserved batter and pour approx. ⅓ cup into frying pan, swirling pan as you add batter to cover base completely. Cook for 2 minutes, on 1 side only, until edges are golden, then transfer onto a plate, cooked side down. Stir batter and repeat frying, adding a teaspoon of butter after each crespelle (makes 8 crespelle - see Tips).

Transfer 1 crespelle into the base of reserved baking dish. Spread approximately 3 tablespoons of the spinach mixture onto 1 crespelle, smoothing with spatula. Place another crespelle on top, then spread with a further 3 tablespoons of spinach mixture. Continue layering crespelle and spinach mixture, finishing with a crespelle (make 8 crespelle in total).

Pour cream over crespelle "cake" and sprinkle with remaining 40 g grated Parmesan. Bake for 5 minutes (220°C). Reset oven setting to grill and grill for 1-2 minutes, until golden brown and bubbling. Scatter with chopped chives before serving (see Tips).

hintsAndTricks: To save time, spread spinach mixture over each crespelle and layer while next crespelle is frying in the pan
Serve this dish as a main, with a green salad on the side, or as a side dish to grilled meat, chicken or fish.
